meanings.sent1: The rabbled gathered in the square, shouting and pushing.
meanings.sent2: The police had to disperse the rabbled before things got out of hand.
meanings.sent3: The rabbled at the concert were so loud, it was hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent4: The rabbled of shoppers swarmed the store during the Black Friday sale.
meanings.sent5: The rabbled surged forward, eager to catch a glimpse of the celebrity.

meanings.definition: To form into a disorderly crowd; to mob.
meanings.sent1: The protestors rabbled outside the government building, demanding change.
meanings.sent2: The fans rabbled around the stage, hoping to get a closer look at the band.
meanings.sent3: The children rabbled around the ice cream truck, excitedly choosing their flavors.
meanings.sent4: The bees rabbled around the hive, preparing for the upcoming winter.
meanings.sent5: The students rabbled in the hallway, causing chaos before the bell rang.
